channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The first grain shipment from Ukraine since the start of Russia’s invasion set sail from the port of Odessa under a deal aimed at easing global food shortages #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/wNpsqOI53u https://t.co/nIR0sQ95Dk
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is planning to visit Taiwan this week and meet with officials, a person familiar said. China has warned against such a visit. https://t.co/PsQO6GbDcO
Wasps are among the most reviled organisms on the planet, but as their many crucial roles show, even the unloved aspects of nature are valuable. https://t.co/emcuDO278J
The first grain shipment since the Russian invasion left Ukraine’s Odessa port under a deal aimed at easing global food shortages https://t.co/n8QqCWhmL9
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/qRci2Jtk71
Guatemalan police have arrested José Rubén Zamora, president of elPeriódico and a vocal critic of the country’s government https://t.co/M7OoRq2rxc

After months of Russian forces making painfully slow gains in Ukraine’s east, the focus of the war is moving to the south, where a potentially decisive phase of the conflict will play out https://t.co/CKHELdsvIL
The campaign to rename New Zealand https://t.co/EQaNXpsa7e
Bill Russell, the towering basketball star and titan of civil rights who was the centerpiece of the Boston Celtics’ dynasty in the 1950s and 1960s, died Sunday at 88 https://t.co/A521JCHBOg
England won the Women's European Championship Sunday, 56 years after the men's team won the country's last major soccer trophy https://t.co/XDGMIuBZDC
Former President Donald Trump is the Saudi-backed golf upstart’s host this weekend. Tickets this weekend start at $1 on StubHub. https://t.co/QQjLkd016T

From @WSJopinion: The lonely office is bad for America, writes @Peggynoonannyc. Employees may like remote work, but it tends to break down both organizational and national culture. https://t.co/sXxX0HVW94
Russia’s intelligence service worked for nearly a decade to recruit members of fringe U.S. political groups to advance pro-Russia propaganda, according to an indictment https://t.co/QCZSHtnD5e
Democrats have been trying to raise taxes on carried interest for 15 years. They might actually do it. https://t.co/Y3RjhnQUgA
Falling prices for commodities such as wheat and corn are set to slow consumer food price increases, easing pressure on a major driver of global inflation https://t.co/NXowW9CJgK
Ferrari made a name for itself with powerful, and loud, internal-combustion engines. Its CEO promises that an all-electric Ferrari won’t be silent. https://t.co/FLWIzS5gDc
Nichelle Nichols, the trailblazing “Star Trek” actress who played Lieutenant Uhura, has died at 89 years old https://t.co/nlrBnaIES9
The U.S. believes a global network of companies has been helping Tehran evade sanctions and export oil by blending it with Iraqi oil at sea to hide its origins https://t.co/06M1qfUoEu
England won the Women's European Championship Sunday, 56 years after the men's team won the country's last major soccer trophy https://t.co/CuusPaWDZQ

Chinese leader Xi Jinping is elevating trusted subordinates into party and government posts that command key levers of political power, galvanizing his authority as he prepares to extend his rule for another five years. https://t.co/N10yUwiQJE
Bill Russell, the towering basketball star and titan of civil rights who was the centerpiece of the Boston Celtics’ dynasty in the 1950s and 1960s, died Sunday at 88 https://t.co/evWFRf79QL

Russia unleashed some of the worst barrages of the war on Ukraine’s southern port city of Mykolaiv, killing among others the owner of one of the nation’s leading agricultural companies https://t.co/YpG9EKNDlR
Mexico wants its artifacts back, including two ancient figurines once featured in Kahlúa ads. https://t.co/qteNjgoppt

The Manchin-Schumer climate, tax and healthcare bill would, for the first time, give the federal government the authority to negotiate how much it pays for some prescription drugs https://t.co/0EYaOMNQsP
Mega Millions says one person in Illinois beat the one-in-302.5-million odds to win the third-largest lottery prize in U.S. history https://t.co/4f1yPduNqY
Former President Donald Trump is the Saudi-backed golf upstart’s host this weekend. Tickets this weekend start at $1 on StubHub. https://t.co/a7UTKgKkDZ
As Russia hammers Kharkiv from across the border, Ukrainian forces say restrictions on the use of Western weapons are limiting their ability to respond https://t.co/dSkvQnlQOl
Russia’s intelligence service worked for nearly a decade to recruit members of fringe U.S. political groups to advance pro-Russia propaganda, according to an indictment https://t.co/wqSJzj0ikk
The worst American energy crisis in five decades is here. How did this happen, and what will it take to fix it? https://t.co/CdFsNqI7yK
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/Uq1XYcWYS4
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/Qe7D2a60Vs https://t.co/OH0jOpsm8q
Biden has tested positive for Covid-19 again, but the president's physician said he is not experiencing any symptoms and is feeling well https://t.co/6VufJ7DpJH

Will Smith has released a video apologizing to comedian Chris Rock months after the onstage Oscars slap. "My behavior was unacceptable" and "I am deeply remorseful," the actor says. https://t.co/7ipkDQ84Gi

From @WSJopinion: Bad policies have produced slow economic growth, falling real wages, and soaring prices. That’s distressing for American families and businesses living through stagflation and a political liability for the Democrats presiding over it. https://t.co/WTrmkP3vrF
About an inch of rain fell within 60 to 90 minutes in Las Vegas, causing flooding in areas including casinos along the Strip https://t.co/Fto5OV9LOI
The SEC on Friday added Alibaba to a list of Chinese companies at risk of being delisted from the U.S. exchanges if their auditors can’t be inspected before spring 2024 https://t.co/6TpXQvIhKF
Sprite is retiring its signature green bottle, which it has used for more than six decades, and will instead use clear bottles that are supposed to be more sustainable https://t.co/6wiTdpQDpP

Ukraine called for Russia to be designated a state sponsor of terrorism as it pushed for an investigation into the killing of scores of Ukrainian prisoners of war on Russian-held territory https://t.co/rNAY1nSLVQ
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/NkpqQR7g6c
Pope Francis said Canada’s historical system of residential schools for indigenous children, many of which were run by Catholic organizations, amounted to a form of genocide https://t.co/nxQFg1H58N
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/qJzSJDC5j8 https://t.co/s3VSdgvxjj

In an turnaround, Sen. Joe Manchin agreed to support an energy, healthcare and tax package, dubbed the Inflation Reduction Act, that could revive President Biden’s economic and climate agenda #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/6GfR6cp0xT https://t.co/dlRAgxtSTc

Justice Samuel Alito warned that secular elements in society pose a threat to religious liberty, urging a largely Catholic audience in Rome to promote the values of religious rights to Americans who may doubt their relevance https://t.co/otctUzLurD

Russia’s intelligence service worked for nearly a decade to recruit members of fringe political groups in the U.S. to advance pro-Russia propaganda, including during the invasion of Ukraine, according to an indictment unsealed Friday https://t.co/BA9Lh3D5gJ
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is planning to visit several major U.S. allies in Asia, with arrangements for a possible stop in Taiwan, despite warnings from China https://t.co/ONB8bqUmLp
At least 15 people, including children, died in Kentucky after flash floods drenched the eastern part of the state and washed away homes, Gov. Andy Beshear said Friday https://t.co/97RkapX4Bs

Chevron reported a record $11.6 billion profit in the second quarter, cashing in on the highest prices for oil and natural gas in more than a decade and hefty fuel-making margins https://t.co/5fJlnLYxLp
If a salesman wants to convince people to buy what he’s selling, it helps if he has a beard, according to a study https://t.co/lYUioeHYdc
Sprite is retiring its signature green bottle, which it has used for more than six decades, and will instead use clear bottles that are supposed to be more sustainable https://t.co/89VqLtjTZP

U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said he planned to raise Brittney Griner’s case with his Russian counterpart, as well as that of another American the U.S. considers wrongfully detained in Russia https://t.co/y9NtQfq0iw
